borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">The development shall be cleared and constructed in
accordance with all recommendations set out in the approved Preliminary
Ecological Appraisal (December 2022). A minimum of 2no. bird boxes should be
installed on the main factory building. All bird boxes shall be installed prior
to first use of the development hereby approved and maintained in perpetuity thereafter.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in
accordance with the submitted Energy and Sustainability Statement&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">prepared by Green Build Consult dated December 2022 to
achieve a 194% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions over&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Part L of the Building Regulations. A post completion
report demonstrating compliance with the submitted Energy and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Sustainability Statement shall be submitted to, and
approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority within six months of&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">first use of any part of the development.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><font face="Arial, sans-serif">Prior to first use of the development hereby&nbsp;approved, one blue
bade parking space shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans and
maintained as such thereafter. It shall include provision for active electric
vehicle charging. No other car parking shall be provided. All operation spaces
for HGVs shall be provided with provision for passive electric vehicle charging
prior to first use.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></font></p>

<p><p>Notwithstanding the details submitted with the application, an archaeological written scheme of investigation (WSI) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to first use of the development hereby approved.&nbsp;<font face="Arial, sans-serif">The agreed WSI
shall include a statement of significance and research objectives around geoarchaeological&nbsp;cores taken from the site, and also:</font><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">A. The
programme and methodology of geoarchaeological assessment and analysis and the
nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed
works;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA">B. The programme for
publication &amp; dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part
of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been
fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the WSI.</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 107%;">The written scheme of investigation will need to be prepared and
implemented by a suitably qualified professionally accredited archaeological
practice in accordance with Historic England’s Guidelines for Archaeological
Projects in Greater London.&nbsp;</span><br></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">Prior to first use of the development, a Delivery and
Servicing Plan for all the proposed uses shall be submitted to an approved&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">in writing by the local planning authority in
consultation with Transport for London (TfL). The approved details shall be
fully&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">implemented before the first use of the development and shall thereafter be permanently retained in an
efficient&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">manner.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">The cycle storage and bin store facilities as shown on
the approved plans, shall be constructed, furnished and made available&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">for use prior to first occupation of any part of the
development hereby approved. 4 long stay cycle parking spaces and 2 short stay
cycle parking spaces shall be provided. These cycle and bin storage areas shall&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">thereafter be maintained and kept available for use by
the occupants at all times.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">Prior to first occupation and notwithstanding the details
submitted with the application, details of a full lighting and CCTV&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">scheme demonstrating compliance with the relevant
standards must be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Planning Authority.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"><br></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">The lighting is to be designed, installed and maintained
so as to fully comply with The Association of Chief Police Officers -&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Secured by Design publication "Lighting Against
Crime - A Guide for Crime Reduction Professionals", ACPO SPD, January&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">2011. It shall also satisfy criteria to limit obtrusive
light as per the requirements of Environmental Zone E2 as set out in the ILP&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Guidance Note for the Reduction of Obtrusive Light.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"><br></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-font-kerning:0pt">The development shall not be occupied until the approved
scheme has been implemented. Thereafter the approved measures&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">shall be permanently retained unless otherwise agreed in
writing by the Local Planning Authority.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><br></p><p>



















</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Notwithstanding
the details submitted with the application, no development above ground floor slab
level shall take place until details of all facing materials and external
surfaces of the buildings hereby approved have been submitted to, and approved
in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. On-site samples shall be provided
for inspection by officers. The development shall be carried out in accordance
with the approved details.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p>No&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">development
shall commence until an air quality neutral report has been submitted to and
approved by the Local Planning Authority. This shall be written in accordance
with the relevant guidance. The development shall be at least “Air Quality
Neutral” and an air quality neutral assessment for both buildings and transport
shall be included in the report. The report shall include all calculations and
be set out so that the Local Planning Authority can fully audit the report and
critically analyse the content and recommendations.</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;
font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:
AR-SA">Should the results from the air quality neutral assessment conclude that
the development is not air quality neutral, a scheme for air pollution
mitigation measures&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">based on the findings of the report shall be submitted to and approved
by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development. This
shall include&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">mitigation for when air quality neutral transport and building
assessments do not meet the benchmarks.</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;
font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:
AR-SA">Where applicable the approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in
its entirety in accordance with details approved prior to first use of the development.
These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;"><br></span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;"><br></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;">No
development shall commence until:</span><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(a)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;">an investigation and risk
assessment, in addition to any assessment provided with the planning
application, has been completed in accordance with a scheme to assess the
nature and extent of any contamination on the site, whether or not it
originates on the site. The contents of the scheme are subject to the approval
in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The investigation and risk
assessment must be undertaken by competent persons and a written report of the
findings must be produced. The written report is subject to the approval in
writing of the Local Planning Authority. The report of the findings must
include: <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:90.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(i)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">a
survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:90.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(ii)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">an
assessment of the potential risks to human health; property (existing or proposed)
including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and
pipes; adjoining land; groundwaters and surface waters; ecological systems;
archaeological sites and ancient monuments; and <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:90.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(iii)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">an
appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s). <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:54.0pt"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">This
must be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency’s ‘Model
Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11’; and</span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(b)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;">a detailed remediation scheme, to
bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use by removing
unacceptable risks to human health, buildings and other property and the
natural and historical environment, has been prepared and submitted to the
Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The scheme must include all works
to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria,
timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that
the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the
Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land
after remediation.<br><br></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(c)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;">The approved remediation scheme must
be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to commencement of the
development, other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise
agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority
must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation
scheme works.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Following
completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a </span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;remediation carried out</span>&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">must be produced and is subject to the approval
in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The report shall include results of</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;sampling
and monitoring carried out to demonstrate that the site remediation criteria
have been met.</span></p><p>





























</p><p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;line-height:normal;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial">(d)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-feature-settings: normal; font-variation-settings: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;">In the event that contamination is
found at any time when carrying out the approved development that was not
previously identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local
Planning Authority. An investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken in
accordance with the requirements of (a), and where remediation is necessary a
remediation scheme must be prepared in accordance with the requirements of (b),
which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme
a verification report must be prepared, which is subject to the approval in
writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size:9.0pt;font-family:NimbusSanL-Regu;
mso-bidi-font-family:NimbusSanL-Regu;mso-font-kerning:0pt">No development shall
take place, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Logistics
Plan, that is in line with the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">TfL guidelines, is
submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in
consultation with TfL. The details&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">shall include the
numbers, size, and routes of construction vehicles, provisions within/around
the site to ensure that all vehicles&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">associated with the
construction works are properly managed to prevent any unwanted disruption to
other highway users, and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">other matters
relating to traffic management to be agreed with the licensing officers of the
council. Approved traffic&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">management to be
agreed with the licensing officers of the council. Consideration shall be given to the use of river transport during the construction phase. Approved details shall be
implemented throughout the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">project period and
any changes to the document must be reported back to the council’s planning and
highways department.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size:9.0pt;font-family:NimbusSanL-Regu;
mso-bidi-font-family:NimbusSanL-Regu;mso-font-kerning:0pt">Notwithstanding the
provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as
amended), the flexible&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: NimbusSanL-Regu; font-size: 9pt;">industrial
floorspace hereby approved shall be used for flexible Use Class B2/B8 (general
industrial, storage and distribution) only. The approved floorspace shall not
be used for any provision equivalent to these Classes, or for any other use, in
any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order without
modification).</span></p>
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.<br>
